qas.question: During which dynasty was Armenia established?
When was Armenia at its largest?
In what year was Caucasus established?
Within what empire was Caucasus created?
Under what dynasty was Caucasus established?

plausible_answers.text: Armenia itself conquered areas populated by other peoples

qas.question: What happened during the reign of Hecataeus of Miletus?

context: The first geographical entity that was called Armenia by neighboring peoples (such as by Hecataeus of Miletus and on <a1_0><b8_0>the Achaemenid Behistun Inscription<b8_0/><a1_0/>) was established <a0_0><b4_0>in the late 6th century BC<b4_0/><a0_0/> under the <a2_0><b6_0>Orontid dynasty<b6_0/><a2_0/> within the <b5_0>Achaemenid Persian Empire<b5_0/> as part of the latters' territories, and which later became a kingdom. At its zenith (<a3_0>95–65 BC<a3_0/>), the state extended from the Caucasus all the way to what is now central Turkey, Lebanon, and northern Iran. The imperial reign of Tigranes the Great is thus the span of time during which <b7_0>Armenia itself conquered areas populated by other peoples<b7_0/>.
